# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

You can create the `wrap_string` function in Julia as follows:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped = ""
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + (line != "" ? 1 : 0) > text_width
            wrapped *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            line *= (line != "" ? " " : "") * word
        end
    end
    wrapped *= line  # Add the last line
    return wrapped
end

# Example usage
example_text = "This is an example of text that will be wrapped."
println(wrap_string(example_text, 10))
```

This function splits the input text into words and constructs lines without exceeding the specified `text_width`. If a line exceeds `text_width`, it starts a new line.
